verse.roman:
ity uktvā sahadevo 'bhūt
tūṣṇīṁ kṛṣṇānubhāva-vit
tac chrutvā tuṣṭuvuḥ sarve
sādhu sādhv iti sattamāḥ

synonyms: iti—thus; uktvā—speaking; sahadevaḥ—Sahadeva; abhūt—became; tūṣṇīm—silent; kṛṣṇa—of Lord Kṛṣṇa; anubhāva—-the influence; vit—who knew well; tat—this; śrutvā—hearing; tuṣṭuvuḥ—praised; sarve—all; sādhu sādhu iti—"excellent, excellent!"; sat—of saintly persons; tamāḥ—the best.
translation: [Śukadeva Gosvāmī continued:] Having said this, Sahadeva, who understood Lord Kṛṣṇa's powers, fell silent. And having heard his words, all the saintly persons present congratulated him, exclaiming "Excellent! Excellent!"
